rules.description: Triggers when at least one object of a specific class is detected.
intent_examples: Notify me when my son comes home
Alert if a person appears
Tell me if someone enters

continuous.description: Runs continuously and triggers whenever the object appears

patrol.description: Runs periodically and checks for the object at intervals

rules.description: Triggers when a gesture or action is detected.
intent_examples: Alert if someone falls down
Notify when fighting happens

rules.description: Triggers when object A comes too close to object B.
intent_examples: Alert if a person gets close to excavator
Notify when forklift approaches worker

rules.description: Triggers when a weapon is detected in the camera view using pose and VLM analysis.
intent_examples: Alert me if someone has a gun
Notify when a weapon is detected
Alert if a person is holding a knife
Tell me if someone carries a firearm

rules.description: Triggers when a person near a machine or in the camera view is detected sleeping (lying down or standing/nodding off). Uses pose keypoints (torso angle, head position, motion) to flag possible sleep, then sends 3 frames to a Vision Language Model (VLM) to confirm before alerting. Works when eyes are not clearly visible (e.g. blurry or distant).
intent_examples: Alert me if someone is sleeping near the machine
Notify when a person is sleeping on the floor
Detect if a worker is sleeping or nodding off
Alert if someone is lying down asleep
Tell me when a person is sleeping standing
Monitor for sleeping persons
Sleep detection near equipment
Alert on sleeping worker

rules.description: Counts objects of a specific class. For crossing detection, user must draw exactly 2 points to create a counting line. The system tracks objects and increments count when the center point of an object crosses the line. Without a line, performs simple per-frame counting.
intent_examples: Count how many people entered the room
Count people crossing the line
How many cars passed through the gate
Count objects crossing this line
How many people are there
count people
count cars
person count
vehicle count
count the workers

zone_support.description: For counting objects crossing a boundary, user draws EXACTLY 2 POINTS to create a line. NO POLYGON NEEDED. The system uses the center point of each detected object - when the center point crosses the user-drawn line, the count increments by 1. Object tracking ensures each object is counted only once. Without a line, the system performs simple per-frame counting of all visible objects.

continuous.description: Continuously counts objects (with or without zone)

rules.description: Counts boxes or packages. For crossing detection, user must draw exactly 2 points to create a counting line. The system tracks boxes and increments count when the center point of a box crosses the line. Without a line, performs simple per-frame counting.
intent_examples: Count boxes
How many boxes are there
Count boxes crossing the line
Count how many packages passed through
How many boxes entered
box count
count the boxes

zone_support.description: For counting boxes crossing a boundary, user draws EXACTLY 2 POINTS to create a line. NO POLYGON NEEDED. The system uses the center point of each detected box - when the center point crosses the user-drawn line, the count increments by 1. Box tracking ensures each box is counted only once. Without a line, the system performs simple per-frame counting of all visible boxes.

continuous.description: Continuously counts boxes (with or without zone/line)

rules.description: Triggers an alert when a specified object is detected inside a restricted zone. User must draw MINIMUM 3 POINTS to create a polygon defining the restricted area. The system checks if the center point of detected objects falls inside the polygon. The zone polygon is visible on the live stream. Applies alert cooldown to prevent spam.
intent_examples: Alert if a person is in the restricted zone
Notify when someone enters the no-go area
Detect if any person is inside the danger zone
Alert when a car is parked in the restricted area
Monitor the restricted zone for unauthorized access

zone_support.description: User must draw a POLYGON with MINIMUM 3 POINTS to define the restricted area. NO LINE DRAWING - ONLY POLYGON. The system uses the center point of each detected object to check if it's inside the polygon zone. If the object's center point is within the polygon boundaries, an alert is triggered. The zone polygon is continuously monitored and visible on the live stream.

continuous.description: Continuously monitors the restricted zone for object presence

patrol.description: Periodically checks the restricted zone for object presence

rules.description: Detects when a person climbs or goes fully above a wall or fence. User draws a POLYGON (minimum 3 points) around the wall boundary. Orange box = person is climbing (part above wall). Red box = person is fully above the wall; once red, the color stays red. Alerts when someone is fully above the wall, with cooldown.
intent_examples: Alert if someone climbs the wall
Detect when a person climbs over the fence
Notify me when someone goes above the wall
Wall climb detection
Alert me if any person climbs the wall
Alert me if any person goes above the wall
Alert me if any person climbs the fence
Alert me if any person goes above the fence
Alert me if any person climbs the boundary
Alert me if any person goes above the boundary
Alert me if any person climbs the wall or fence
Alert me if any person goes above the wall or fence
Alert if person jumps above the wall
Monitor for people climbing the boundary

zone_support.description: User must draw a POLYGON with MINIMUM 3 POINTS around the WALL or FENCE (top, sides, bottom). The system detects when a person's bounding box is partly or fully above the wall. Orange = climbing; red = fully above (stays red).

rules.description: Detects when a person falls down using pose keypoint analysis. Monitors body angle, height, and sudden downward movement to identify falls. Requires pose detection model (YOLOv8 Pose). Triggers alert when fall is confirmed after multiple consecutive frames.
intent_examples: Alert me if any person fall detected
Alert me if any fall detected
Notify me when someone falls down
Detect if a person falls
Alert if someone falls
Tell me if a person falls
Monitor for falls
Detect human falls
Alert on fall detection
Notify when fall is detected

rules.description: Detects fire, flame, or smoke anywhere in the camera view (no zone). Uses a fine-tuned YOLO model. Triggers critical alerts when fire is detected, based on user settings: confidence_threshold, confirm_frames, and alert_cooldown_seconds. Consecutive frame confirmation reduces false positives from flickering lights or reflections. Zone is not used; the entire frame is always monitored.
intent_examples: Alert me if any fire detected
If any fire detected alert me
Notify me when there is fire
Detect fire in the area
Alert if fire is detected
Tell me if there is a fire
Monitor for fire
Detect flames
Alert on fire detection
Notify when fire is detected
Alert me if there is smoke
Detect smoke or fire
Fire alarm
Fire alert
Watch for fire
Fire monitoring

zone_support.description: This rule does not use a zone. Fire, flame, or smoke is detected anywhere in the full camera view. Zone fields are ignored.

continuous.description: Continuously monitors for fire detection. Recommended for safety-critical applications.

rules.description: Alerts when a specific person appears in the camera view. Uses DeepFace (ArcFace) with face embeddings from the Person Gallery (MongoDB). Add people via the Person Gallery first; then create this rule with watch_names (e.g. ["sachin"]). Gallery persons must have status "active" and embedding_model "ArcFace". If you previously used Facenet, re-upload photos so embeddings are ArcFace. Matching uses cosine similarity: tolerance (default 0.55) is the minimum similarity to consider a face a match; it is used as min_similarity when min_similarity/similarity_threshold are not set. Lower tolerance = more lenient matching; typical range 0.5–0.7. Bounding box stays visible until the person leaves the frame (cleared after 15 consecutive frames with no face). No zone required. No YOLO for faces—recognition is embedding-based.
intent_examples: Alert me if sachin appears on camera 1
Notify when John is detected
Alert if this person appears
Tell me when sachin is seen
Alert me if sachin appears

continuous.description: Continuously monitors for the specified person(s)

rules.description: Notifies when a machine (e.g. loom) is idle for longer than a configurable threshold (in minutes). Uses industrial-grade motion detection: OpenCV MOG2 background subtraction plus morphological cleanup and a rolling-window motion ratio. No YOLO—model is 'none'. User draws one motion ROI (polygon) per machine around the moving parts; the system samples frames per minute, computes motion ratio per ROI, and uses a 15-second rolling average with hysteresis (RUNNING when avg motion > 0.02, STOPPED when < 0.005). When idle duration exceeds the user-specified threshold, an alert is sent (email/Kafka) and the machine is highlighted. The idle threshold must be provided by the user during agent creation.
intent_examples: Notify me if the machine is idle for more than 15 minutes
Alert when a machine stops for more than 15 min
Tell me if the loom has been idle for too long
Machine idle detection
Alert if machine on idle state for more than 15 min

zone_support.description: User must draw one polygon (motion ROI) per machine around the moving parts. Each ROI defines where to measure pixel movement. Draw at least one polygon; multiple machines = multiple polygons. The system converts each polygon to a bounding box and uses these regions to decide if the machine is running or idle.

continuous.description: Continuously monitors machine motion and alerts when idle too long
